span.title: <em>DeKalb County School District provides automatic translation, courtesy of Google Translate. The English language version is considered the most accurate. In the event of a disagreement or discrepancy between the translation and the original English version of this website or any notice or disclaimer, the original version will prevail.

div.div:
×
We have transitioned to a modified meal service plan.
Under the new plan, meals are distributed on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays from 10:00 am – 12:00 pm.
Students will receive a two-day meal package on each Monday, Wednesday, and Friday as shown in the chart below. The 21 meal distribution sites will remain operational and the bus meal delivery will continue following the amended plan of meal service on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays.
Meal Distribution Days (10:00 am – 12:00 pm) Number of Meals
Monday 2 Lunch Meals & 2 Snacks
Wednesday 2 Lunch Meals & 2 Snacks
Friday 2 Lunch Meals & 2 Snacks
Parents can also locate additional food resources through Food Finder

div.class: fusion-alert alert custom alert-custom fusion-alert-center fusion-alert-capitalize alert-dismissable

div.span:
Lithonia High School meal distribution site has been closed effective 4/20/2020.
Parents and students may pick up meals from 10:00 AM — 12:00 PM at neighboring sites: Marbut Elementary School and Stephenson Middle School. Transported meals will continue to be distributed throughout the community.

div.span: These are estimated times. Inclement weather or other factors may impact arrival times.

tr.td:

The Life at Peppertree Circle

li.div: Children 18 and under are eligible for Grab-and-Go meals.
Children do not need to qualify for the free and reduced meal program.
Children do not need to show identification.

div.strong: Parents can pick up meals for children daily, but must provide a daily Grab-and Go verification form.

li.div: Parents are responsible to identify if their children have special food allergies. There are no substitute meals available in this USDA special waiver program.
Children do not need to attend the school where the meals are distributed.

div.p: If you go to Grab-and-Go, please be patient and follow all directions from DeKalb County Schools’ staff on-site. We are committed to maintaining a safe and healthy environment, reinforcing social distancing protocols, and creating a smooth traffic flow.

li.div: Families using the drive-thru service must remain in their vehicle. Do not get out.
Please place your car in the Parked (P) position to reduce the potential for injury to staff and pedestrians.
Pedestrians must take their Grab-and-Go meals home and not remain in the area to eat.
Pedestrians waiting in line must maintain a 6-ft distance from other people. Do not shake hands with other individuals.
Children walking or biking should bring a backpack to carry their Grab-and-Go meals home.
Early Learning Center at Terry Mill
Meals served per week on average by DeKalb County Schools – 30,000
Snacks served per week on average by DeKalb County Schools – 30,000
Food served weekly by Atlanta Food Bank – 1,345
Early Learning Center at Terry Mill ES

div.h3: Partners who have assisted with food at sites

li.div: Panera Bread (forthcoming in the next 2 weeks – estimated week of April 26)
Gateway Gourmet/United Way (forthcoming in the next 2 weeks – estimated week of April 26)

div.p: Note: If you are interested in a partnership opportunity, please email us at Supt@dekalbschoolsga.org.

p.em: DeKalb County School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability or age in its programs and activities, and provides equal access to the Boys Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following person has been designated to handle inquiries regarding the non-discrimination policies including Title IX: Marissa Key, Interim Chief Legal Officer - Office of Legal Affairs | P. 678.676.0107
